marsMIB.name: marsMIB

revisions.description: Published as RFC 2417. Changes/fixes: - reroot this MIB from snmpModules to mib-2 to be consistent with location of other MIBs. - obsoletes RFC2366.

marsMIB.contactinfo: Chris Chung (chihschung@aol.com) Independent Consultant Editor: Maria Greene Postal: Independent Contractor E-mail: maria@xedia.com
marsMIB.description: This module defines a portion of the managed information base (MIB) for managing classical IP multicast address resolution server (MARS) and related entities as described in the RFC2022. This MIB is meant to be used in conjunction with the ATM-MIB (RFC1695), MIB-II (RFC1213), and optionally the IF-MIB (RFC1573).

marsClientTable.name: marsClientTable
marsClientTable.description: The objects defined in this table are used for the management of MARS clients, ATM attached endpoints.

marsClientEntry.name: marsClientEntry
marsClientEntry.description: Each entry contains a MARS client and its associated attributes. An entry in the marsClientTable has a corresponding entry in the ipAddrTable defined in RFC1213. Association between the ipAddrTable and the marsClientTable is made through the index, ipAdEntAddr.

marsClientIndex.name: marsClientIndex
marsClientIndex.description: The auxiliary variable used to identify instances of the columnar objects in the MARS MarsClientTable.

marsClientAddr.name: marsClientAddr
marsClientAddr.description: The ATM address associated with the ATM Client.

marsClientDefaultMarsAddr.name: marsClientDefaultMarsAddr
marsClientDefaultMarsAddr.description: The default MARS ATM address which is needed to setup the initial signalling path between a MARS client and its associated MARS.

marsClientHsn.name: marsClientHsn
marsClientHsn.description: The cluster membership own 32 bit Host Sequence Number. When a new cluster member starts up, it is initialized to zero. When the cluster member sends the MARS_JOIN to register, the HSN will be correctly set to the current cluster sequence number (CSN) when the Client receives the copy of its MARS_JOIN from the MARS. It is is used to track the MARS sequence number.

marsClientRegistration.name: marsClientRegistration
marsClientRegistration.description: An indication with regards to the registration status of this client. The registration codes of 'notRegistered (1)', 'registered (2)', and registered (3) are self-explanatory. The 'reRegisteringFault (4)' indicates the client is in the process of re-registering with a MARS due to some fault conditions. The 'reRegisteringRedMap (5)' status code shows that client is re-registering because it has received a MARS_REDIRECT_MAP message and was told to register with a different MARS from the current MARS.

marsClientCmi.name: marsClientCmi
marsClientCmi.description: 16 bit Cluster member identifier (CMI) assigned by the MARS which uniquely identifies each endpoint attached to the cluster. The value becomes valid after the 'marsClientRegistration' is set to the value of 'registered (1)'.

marsClientDefaultMtu.name: marsClientDefaultMtu
marsClientDefaultMtu.description: The default maximum transmission unit (MTU) used for this cluster. Note that the actual size used for a VC between two members of the cluster may be negotiated during connection setup and may be different than this value. Default value = 9180 bytes.

marsClientFailureTimer.name: marsClientFailureTimer
marsClientFailureTimer.description: A timer used to flag the failure of last MARS_MULTI to arrive. Default value = 10 seconds (recommended).

marsClientRetranDelayTimer.name: marsClientRetranDelayTimer
marsClientRetranDelayTimer.description: The delay timer for sending out new MARS_REQUEST for the group after the client learned that there is no other group in the cluster. The timer must be set between 5 and 10 seconds inclusive.

marsClientRdmMulReqAddRetrTimer.name: marsClientRdmMulReqAddRetrTimer
marsClientRdmMulReqAddRetrTimer.description: The initial random L_MULTI_RQ/ADD retransmit timer which can be set between 5 and 10 seconds inclusive.

marsClientRdmVcRevalidateTimer.name: marsClientRdmVcRevalidateTimer
marsClientRdmVcRevalidateTimer.description: The random time to set VC_revalidate flag. The timer value ranges between 1 and 10 seconds inclusive.

marsClientJoinLeaveRetrInterval.name: marsClientJoinLeaveRetrInterval
marsClientJoinLeaveRetrInterval.description: MARS_JOIN/LEAVE retransmit interval. The minimum and recommended values are 5 and 10 seconds, respectively.

marsClientJoinLeaveRetrLimit.name: marsClientJoinLeaveRetrLimit
marsClientJoinLeaveRetrLimit.description: MARS_JOIN/LEAVE retransmit limit. The maximum value is 5.

marsClientRegWithMarsRdmTimer.name: marsClientRegWithMarsRdmTimer
marsClientRegWithMarsRdmTimer.description: Random time to register with MARS.

marsClientForceWaitTimer.name: marsClientForceWaitTimer
marsClientForceWaitTimer.description: Force wait if MARS re-registration is looping. The minimum value is 1 minute.

marsClientLmtToMissRedirMapTimer.name: marsClientLmtToMissRedirMapTimer
marsClientLmtToMissRedirMapTimer.description: Timer limit for client to miss MARS_REDIRECT_MAPS.

marsClientIdleTimer.name: marsClientIdleTimer
marsClientIdleTimer.description: The configurable inactivity timer associated with a client. When a VC is created at this client, it gets the idle timer value from this configurable timer. The minimum suggested value is 1 minute and the recommended default value is 20 minutes.

marsClientRowStatus.name: marsClientRowStatus
marsClientRowStatus.description: The object is used to create, delete or modify a row in this table. A row cannot be made 'active' until instances of all corresponding columns in the row of this table are appropriately configured and until the agent has also created a corresponding row in the marsClientStatTable. When this object has a value of 'active', the following columnar objects can not be modified: marsClientDefaultMarsAddr, marsClientHsn, marsClientRegstration, marsClientCmi, marsClientDefaultMtu while other objects in this conceptual row can be modified irrespective of the value of this object. Deletion of this row is allowed regardless of whether or not a row in any associated tables (i.e., marsClientVcTable) still exists or is in use. Once this row is deleted, it is recommended that the agent or the SNMP management station (if possible) through the set command deletes any stale rows that are associated with this row.

marsClientMcGrpTable.name: marsClientMcGrpTable
marsClientMcGrpTable.description: This table contains a list of IP multicast group address blocks associated with a MARS client. Entries in this table are used by the client that needs to receive or transmit packets from/to the specified range of multicast addresses. Each row can be created or deleted via configuration.

marsClientMcGrpEntry.name: marsClientMcGrpEntry
marsClientMcGrpEntry.description: Each entry represents a consecutive block of multicast group addresses.

marsClientMcMinGrpAddr.name: marsClientMcMinGrpAddr
marsClientMcMinGrpAddr.description: Minimum multicast group address - the min and max multicast forms multi-group block. If the MinGrpAddr and MaxGrpAddr are the same, it indicates that this block contains a single group address.

marsClientMcMaxGrpAddr.name: marsClientMcMaxGrpAddr
marsClientMcMaxGrpAddr.description: Maximum multicast group address - the min and max multicast forms a multi-group block. If the MinGrpAddr and MaxGrpAddr are the same, it indicates that this block contains a single group address.

marsClientMcGrpRowStatus.name: marsClientMcGrpRowStatus
marsClientMcGrpRowStatus.description: The object is used to create or delete a row in this table. Since other objects in this row are not-accessible 'index-objects', the value of this object has no effect on whether those objects in this conceptual row can be modified.

marsClientBackupMarsTable.name: marsClientBackupMarsTable
marsClientBackupMarsTable.description: This table contains a list of backup MARS addresses that a client can connect to in case of failure for connecting to the primary server. The list of addresses is in descending order of preference. It should be noted that the backup list provided by the MARS to the client via the MARS_REDIRECT_MAP message has a higher preference than addresses that are manually configured into the client. When such a list is received from the MARS, this information should be inserted at the top of the list. Each row can be created or deleted via configuration.

marsClientBackupMarsEntry.name: marsClientBackupMarsEntry
marsClientBackupMarsEntry.description: Each entry represents an ATM address of a backup MARS.

marsClientBackupMarsPriority.name: marsClientBackupMarsPriority
marsClientBackupMarsPriority.description: The priority associated with a backup MARS. A lower priority value inidcates a higher preference.

marsClientBackupMarsAddr.name: marsClientBackupMarsAddr
marsClientBackupMarsAddr.description: The ATM address associated with a backup MARS.

marsClientBackupMarsRowStatus.name: marsClientBackupMarsRowStatus
marsClientBackupMarsRowStatus.description: The object is used to create or delete a row in this table. Since other objects in this row are not-accessible 'index-objects', the value of this object has no effect on whether those objects in this conceptual row can be modified.

marsClientVcTable.name: marsClientVcTable
marsClientVcTable.description: This table contains information about open virtual circuits (VCs) that a client has. For point to point circuit, each entry represents a single VC connection between this client ATM address to another party ATM address. In the case of point to multipoint connection where a single source address is associated with multiple destinations, several entries are used to represent the relationship. An example of point to multi-point VC represented in a table is shown below. Client VPI/VCI Grp Addr1/Addr2 Part Addr 1 0,1 g1,g2 p1 1 0,1 g1,g2 p2 1 0,1 g1,g2 p3 Note: This table assumes the IP multicast address groups (min, max) defined in each entry are always consecutive. In the case of that a client receives a JOIN/LEAVE with mars$flag.punched set, each pair of the IP groups will first be broken into several pairs of consecutive IP groups before each entry row corresponding to a pair of IP group is created.

marsClientVcEntry.name: marsClientVcEntry
marsClientVcEntry.description: The objects contained in the entry are VC related attributes such as VC signalling type, control VC type, idle timer, negotiated MTU size, etc.

marsClientVcVpi.name: marsClientVcVpi
marsClientVcVpi.description: The value of virtual path identifier (VPI). Since a VPI can be numbered 0, this sub-index can take a value of 0.

marsClientVcVci.name: marsClientVcVci
marsClientVcVci.description: The value of virtual circuit identifier (VCI). Since a VCI can be numbered 0, this sub-index can take a value of 0.

marsClientVcMinGrpAddr.name: marsClientVcMinGrpAddr
marsClientVcMinGrpAddr.description: Minimum IP multicast group address - the min and max multicast forms a multi-group consecutive block which is associated with a table entry. if the MinGrpAddr and MaxGrpAddr are the same, it indicates that the size of multi-group block is 1, a single IP group.

marsClientVcMaxGrpAddr.name: marsClientVcMaxGrpAddr
marsClientVcMaxGrpAddr.description: Maximum IP multicast group address - the min and max multicast forms a multi-group consecutive block which is associated with a table entry. if the MinGrpAddr and MaxGrpAddr are the same, it indicates that the size of multi-group block is 1, a single IP group.

marsClientVcPartyAddr.name: marsClientVcPartyAddr
marsClientVcPartyAddr.description: An ATM party address in which this VC is linked. The party type is identified by the marsClientVcPartyAddrType.

marsClientVcPartyAddrType.name: marsClientVcPartyAddrType
marsClientVcPartyAddrType.description: The party type is associated with the party address. The 'called (1)' indicates that the party address is a destination address which implies that VC is originated from this client. The 'calling (2)' indicates the VC was initiated externally to this client. In this case, the party address is the source address.

marsClientVcType.name: marsClientVcType
marsClientVcType.description: Circuit Connection type: permanent virtual circuit or switched virtual circuit.

marsClientVcCtrlType.name: marsClientVcCtrlType
marsClientVcCtrlType.description: Control VC type used to specify a particular connection. pointToPointVC (1): used by the ATM Clients for the registration and queries. This VC or the initial signalling path is set up from the source Client to a MARS. It is bi-directional. clusterControlVC (2): used by a MARS to issue asynchronous updates to an ATM Client. This VC is established from the MARS to the ATM Client. pointToMultiPointVC (3): used by the client to transfer multicast data packets from layer 3. This VC is established from the source ATM Client to a destination ATM endpoint which can be a multicast group member or an MCS. The destination endpoint was obtained from the MARS.

marsClientVcIdleTimer.name: marsClientVcIdleTimer
marsClientVcIdleTimer.description: The idle timer associated with this VC. The minimum suggested value is 1 minute and the recommended default value is 20 minutes.

marsClientVcRevalidate.name: marsClientVcRevalidate
marsClientVcRevalidate.description: A flag associated with an open and active multipoint VC. It is checked every time a packet is queued for transmission on that VC. The object has the value of true (1) if revalidate is required and the value false (2) otherwise.

marsClientVcEncapsType.name: marsClientVcEncapsType
marsClientVcEncapsType.description: The encapsulation type used when communicating over this VC.

marsClientVcNegotiatedMtu.name: marsClientVcNegotiatedMtu
marsClientVcNegotiatedMtu.description: The negotiated MTU when communicating over this VC.

marsClientVcRowStatus.name: marsClientVcRowStatus
marsClientVcRowStatus.description: The object is used to create, delete or modify a row in this table. A row cannot be made 'active' until instances of all corresponding columns in the row of this table are appropriately configured. While objects: marsClientVcIdleTimer and marsClientVcRevalidate in this conceptual row can be modified irrespective of the value of this object, all other objects in the row can not be modified when this object has a value of 'active'. It is possible for an SNMP management station to set the row to 'notInService' and modify the entry and then set it back to 'active' with the following exception. That is, rows for which the corresponding instance of marsClientVcType has a value of 'svc' can not be modified or deleted.

marsClientStatTable.name: marsClientStatTable
marsClientStatTable.description: The table contains statistics collected at MARS clients.

marsClientStatEntry.name: marsClientStatEntry
marsClientStatEntry.description: Each entry contains statistics collected at one MARS client.

marsClientStatTxReqMsgs.name: marsClientStatTxReqMsgs
marsClientStatTxReqMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_REQUEST messages transmitted from a client.

marsClientStatTxJoinMsgs.name: marsClientStatTxJoinMsgs
marsClientStatTxJoinMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_JOIN messages transmitted from a client.

marsClientStatTxLeaveMsgs.name: marsClientStatTxLeaveMsgs
marsClientStatTxLeaveMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_LEAVE messages transmitted from a client.

marsClientStatTxGrpLstReqMsgs.name: marsClientStatTxGrpLstReqMsgs
marsClientStatTxGrpLstReqMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_GROUPLIST_REQUEST messages transmitted from a client.

marsClientStatRxJoinMsgs.name: marsClientStatRxJoinMsgs
marsClientStatRxJoinMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_JOIN messages received by a client.

marsClientStatRxLeaveMsgs.name: marsClientStatRxLeaveMsgs
marsClientStatRxLeaveMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_LEAVE messages received by a client.

marsClientStatRxMultiMsgs.name: marsClientStatRxMultiMsgs
marsClientStatRxMultiMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_MULTI messages received by a client.

marsClientStatRxNakMsgs.name: marsClientStatRxNakMsgs
marsClientStatRxNakMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_NAK messages received by a client.

marsClientStatRxMigrateMsgs.name: marsClientStatRxMigrateMsgs
marsClientStatRxMigrateMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_MIGRATE messages received by a client.

marsClientStatRxGrpLstRplyMsgs.name: marsClientStatRxGrpLstRplyMsgs
marsClientStatRxGrpLstRplyMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_GROUPLIST_REPLY messages received by a client.

marsClientStatFailMultiMsgs.name: marsClientStatFailMultiMsgs
marsClientStatFailMultiMsgs.description: Total number of timeouts occurred indicating failure of the last MARS_MULTI to arrive.

marsTable.name: marsTable
marsTable.description: The objects defined in this table are used for the management of MARS servers.

marsEntry.name: marsEntry
marsEntry.description: Each entry contains a MARS and its associated attributes.

marsIndex.name: marsIndex
marsIndex.description: The auxiliary variable used to identify instances of the columnar objects in the MARS table.

marsIfIndex.name: marsIfIndex
marsIfIndex.description: The ifIndex of the interface that the MARS is associated with.

marsAddr.name: marsAddr
marsAddr.description: The ATM address associated with the MARS.

marsLocal.name: marsLocal
marsLocal.description: A flag associated with a MARS entry. The object has the value of true (1) if the MARS whose interface is local to the machine that implements this MIB; otherwise the object has the value of false (2).

marsServType.name: marsServType
marsServType.description: Types of MARS servers: primary or backup.

marsServPriority.name: marsServPriority
marsServPriority.description: Priority associated with a backup MARS server. A backup MARS server with lower priority value indicates a higher preference than other backup MARS servers to be used as the MARS server when the primary server fails.

marsRedirMapMsgTimer.name: marsRedirMapMsgTimer
marsRedirMapMsgTimer.description: Periodic interval on which a multi-part MARS_REDIRECT_MAP is sent from this MARS.

marsCsn.name: marsCsn
marsCsn.description: Current cluster sequence number (CSN) which is global within the context of a given protocol. The CSN is incremented by the MARS on every transmission of a message on ClusterControlVC. A cluster member uses the CSN to track the message loss on ClusterControlVC or to monitor a membership change.

marsSsn.name: marsSsn
marsSsn.description: Current server sequence number (SSN) which is global within the context of a given protocol. The SSN is incremented by the MARS on every transmission of a message on ServerControlVC. A MCS uses the SSN to track the message loss on ServerControlVC or to monitor a membership change.

marsRowStatus.name: marsRowStatus
marsRowStatus.description: The object is used to create, delete or modify a row in this table. A row cannot be made 'active' until instances of all corresponding columns in the row of this table are appropriately configured and until the agent has also created a corresponding row in the marsStatTable. When this object has a value of 'active', the following columnar objects can not be modified: marsAddr, marsAddrLocal, marsServStatus, marsServType, marsCsn, marsSsn while other objects in this conceptual row can be modified irrespective of the value of this object. Deletion of this row is allowed regardless of whether or not a row in any associated tables (i.e., marsVcTable) still exists or is in use. Once this row is deleted, it is recommended that the agent or the SNMP management station (if possible) through the set command deletes any stale rows that are associated with this row.

marsMcGrpTable.name: marsMcGrpTable
marsMcGrpTable.description: This table contains a list of IP multicast address blocks associated with a MARS. Entries in this table are used by the MARS host map table and the server map table. They should be created prior to being referenced as indices by those tables. Each row can be created or deleted via configuration.

marsMcGrpEntry.name: marsMcGrpEntry
marsMcGrpEntry.description: Each entry represents a consecutive block of multicast group addresses.

marsMcMinGrpAddr.name: marsMcMinGrpAddr
marsMcMinGrpAddr.description: Minimum multicast group address - the min and max multicast forms multi-group block. If the MinGrpAddr and MaxGrpAddr are the same, it indicates that this block contains a single group address.

marsMcMaxGrpAddr.name: marsMcMaxGrpAddr
marsMcMaxGrpAddr.description: Maximum multicast group address - the min and max multicast forms a multi-group block. If The MinGrpAddr and MaxGrpAddr are the same, it indicates that this block contains a single group address.

marsMcGrpAddrUsage.name: marsMcGrpAddrUsage
marsMcGrpAddrUsage.description: Usage of the multicast address block. The hostMap (1) indicates that the address block is only used in the MARS host map table. The serverMap (2) indicates that the address block is only used in the MARS server map table. The hostServerMap (3) indicates that the address block is used in both the host map and the server map tables.

marsMcGrpRxLayer3GrpSets.name: marsMcGrpRxLayer3GrpSets
marsMcGrpRxLayer3GrpSets.description: Number of MARS_JOIN messages received with mars$flags.layer3grp flag set.

marsMcGrpRxLayer3GrpResets.name: marsMcGrpRxLayer3GrpResets
marsMcGrpRxLayer3GrpResets.description: Number of MARS_JOIN messages received with mars$flags.layer3grp flag reset.

marsMcGrpRowStatus.name: marsMcGrpRowStatus
marsMcGrpRowStatus.description: The object is used to create, delete or modify a row in this table. The value of this object has no effect on whether other objects in this conceptual row can be modified.

marsHostMapTable.name: marsHostMapTable
marsHostMapTable.description: This table caches mappings between IP multicast address to a list of ATM addresses that are configured or dynamically learned from the MARS. This address resolution is used for the host map. It supports the mapping of a block of multicast group addresses to a cluster member address. In the case where a group block is associated with multiple cluster members, several entries are used to representing the relationship.

marsHostMapEntry.name: marsHostMapEntry
marsHostMapEntry.description: Each entry row contains attributes associated with the mapping between a multicast group block and an ATM address.

marsHostMapAtmAddr.name: marsHostMapAtmAddr
marsHostMapAtmAddr.description: The mapped cluster member ATM address.

marsHostMapRowType.name: marsHostMapRowType
marsHostMapRowType.description: Method in which this entry row is created. The static (1) indicates that this row is created through configuration. The dynamic (2) indicates that the row is created as the result of group address updates received at this MARS.

marsHostMapRowStatus.name: marsHostMapRowStatus
marsHostMapRowStatus.description: The object is used to create, delete or modify a row in this table. This object must not be set to 'active' until instances of all corresponding columns in the row of this table are appropriately configured. It is possible for an SNMP management station to set the row to 'notInService' and modify the entry and then set it back to 'active' with the following exception. That is, rows for which the corresponding instance of marsHostMapRowType has a value of 'dynamic' can not be modified or deleted.

marsServerMapTable.name: marsServerMapTable
marsServerMapTable.description: This table caches mappings between IP multicast address to a list of MCS ATM addresses that are configured or dynamically learned from the MARS. This address resolution is used for the server map. It supports the mapping of a block of multicast group addresses to a MCS address. In the case where a group block is associated with multiple MCSs, several entries are used to representing the relationship.

marsServerMapEntry.name: marsServerMapEntry
marsServerMapEntry.description: Each entry row contains attributes associated with the mapping between a multicast group block and an MCS address.

marsServerMapRowType.name: marsServerMapRowType
marsServerMapRowType.description: Method in which this entry row is created. The 'static (1)' indicates that this row is created through configuration. The 'dynamic (2)' indicates that the row is created as the result of group address updates received at this MARS.

marsServerMapRowStatus.name: marsServerMapRowStatus
marsServerMapRowStatus.description: The object is used to create, delete or modify a row in this table. This object must not be set to 'active' until instances of all corresponding columns in the row of this table are appropriately configured. It is possible for an SNMP management station to set the row to 'notInService' and modify the entry and then set it back to 'active' with the following exception. That is, rows for which the corresponding instance of marsServerMapRowType has a value of 'dynamic' can not be modified or deleted.

marsVcTable.name: marsVcTable
marsVcTable.description: This table contains information about open virtual circuits (VCs) that a MARS has. For point to point circuit, each entry represents a single VC connection between this MARS ATM address to another party's ATM address. In the case of point to multipoint connection where a ControlVc is attached with multiple leaf nodes, several entries are used to represent the relationship. An example of point to multi-point VC represented in a table is shown below. MARS VPI/VCI MARS Addr Party Addr 1 0,1 m1 p1 1 0,1 m1 p2 1 0,1 m1 p3

marsVcEntry.name: marsVcEntry
marsVcEntry.description: The objects contained in the entry are VC related attributes such as VC signalling type, control VC type, idle timer, negotiated MTU size, etc.

marsVcVpi.name: marsVcVpi
marsVcVpi.description: The value of virtual path identifier (VPI). Since a VPI can be numbered 0, this sub-index can take a value of 0.

marsVcVci.name: marsVcVci
marsVcVci.description: The value of virtual circuit identifier (VCI). Since a VCI can be numbered 0, this sub-index can take a value of 0.

marsVcPartyAddr.name: marsVcPartyAddr
marsVcPartyAddr.description: An ATM party address in which this VC is linked. The party type is identified by the marsVcPartyAddrType.

marsVcPartyAddrType.name: marsVcPartyAddrType
marsVcPartyAddrType.description: The party type is associated with the party address. The 'called (1)' indicates that the party address is a destination address which implies that VC is originated from this MARS. The 'calling (2)' indicates the VC was initiated externally to this MARS. The party address is the source address.

marsVcType.name: marsVcType
marsVcType.description: Circuit Connection type: permanent virtual circuit or switched virtual circuit.

marsVcCtrlType.name: marsVcCtrlType
marsVcCtrlType.description: Control VC type used to specify a particular connection. pointToPointVC (1): used by the ATM endpoints (clients) or the MCS for registration and queries. This VC is set up from a MARS client and MCS to this MARS. It is a bi-directional VC. clusterControlVC (2): used by MARS to issue asynchronous updates to ATM an ATM client. This VC is established from the MARs to the ATM client. serverControlVC (3): used by MARS to issue asynchronous update to ATM multicast servers. This type of VC exists when at least a MCS is being used.

marsVcIdleTimer.name: marsVcIdleTimer
marsVcIdleTimer.description: The idle timer associated with this VC. The minimum suggested value is 1 minute and the recommended default value is 20 minutes.

marsVcCmi.name: marsVcCmi
marsVcCmi.description: Cluster member identifier (CMI) which uniquely identifies each endpoint attached to the cluster. This variable applies to each 'leaf node' of an outgoing control VC.

marsVcEncapsType.name: marsVcEncapsType
marsVcEncapsType.description: The encapsulation type used when communicating over this VC.

marsVcNegotiatedMtu.name: marsVcNegotiatedMtu
marsVcNegotiatedMtu.description: The negotiated MTU when communicating over this VC.

marsVcRowStatus.name: marsVcRowStatus
marsVcRowStatus.description: The object is used to create, delete or modify a row in this table. A row cannot be made 'active' until instances of all corresponding columns in the row of this table are appropriately configured. While the marsVcIdleTimer in this conceptual row can be modified irrespective of the value of this object, all other objects in the row can not be modified when this object has a value of 'active'. It is possible for an SNMP management station to set the row to 'notInService' and modify the entry and then set it back to 'active' with the following exception. That is, rows for which the corresponding instance of marsVcType has a value of 'svc' can not be modified or deleted.

marsRegClientTable.name: marsRegClientTable
marsRegClientTable.description: This table contains ATM identities of all the currently registered cluster members at a MARS. Each entry represents one set of ATM identities associated with one cluster member or the MARS client.

marsRegClientEntry.name: marsRegClientEntry
marsRegClientEntry.description: Each entry row contains attributes associated with one register cluster member.

marsRegClientCmi.name: marsRegClientCmi
marsRegClientCmi.description: This cluster member identifier is used as an auxiliary index for the entry in this table.

marsRegMcsTable.name: marsRegMcsTable
marsRegMcsTable.description: This table contains ATM identities of all the currently registered MCSs at a MARS. Each entry represents one set of ATM identities associated with one MCS.

marsRegMcsEntry.name: marsRegMcsEntry
marsRegMcsEntry.description: Each entry row contains attributes associated with one registered MCS.

marsStatTable.name: marsStatTable
marsStatTable.description: The table contains statistics collected at MARS.

marsStatEntry.name: marsStatEntry
marsStatEntry.description: Each entry contains statistics collected at one MARS.

marsStatTxMultiMsgs.name: marsStatTxMultiMsgs
marsStatTxMultiMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_MULTI transmitted by this MARS.

marsStatTxGrpLstRplyMsgs.name: marsStatTxGrpLstRplyMsgs
marsStatTxGrpLstRplyMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_GROUPLIST_REPLY messages transmitted by this MARS.

marsStatTxRedirectMapMsgs.name: marsStatTxRedirectMapMsgs
marsStatTxRedirectMapMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_REDIRECT_MAP messages transmitted by this MARS.

marsStatTxMigrateMsgs.name: marsStatTxMigrateMsgs
marsStatTxMigrateMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_MIGRATE messages transmitted by this MARS.

marsStatTxNakMsgs.name: marsStatTxNakMsgs
marsStatTxNakMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_NAK messages transmitted by this MARS.

marsStatTxJoinMsgs.name: marsStatTxJoinMsgs
marsStatTxJoinMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_JOIN messages transmitted by this MARS.

marsStatTxLeaveMsgs.name: marsStatTxLeaveMsgs
marsStatTxLeaveMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_LEAVE messages transmitted by this MARS.

marsStatTxSjoinMsgs.name: marsStatTxSjoinMsgs
marsStatTxSjoinMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_SJOIN messages transmitted by this MARS.

marsStatTxSleaveMsgs.name: marsStatTxSleaveMsgs
marsStatTxSleaveMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_SLEAVE messages transmitted by this MARS.

marsStatTxMservMsgs.name: marsStatTxMservMsgs
marsStatTxMservMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_MSERV messages transmitted by this MARS.

marsStatTxUnservMsgs.name: marsStatTxUnservMsgs
marsStatTxUnservMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_UNSERV messages transmitted by this MARS.

marsStatRxReqMsgs.name: marsStatRxReqMsgs
marsStatRxReqMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_REQUEST messages received by this MARS.

marsStatRxGrpLstReqMsgs.name: marsStatRxGrpLstReqMsgs
marsStatRxGrpLstReqMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_GROUPLIST_REQUEST messages received by this MARS.

marsStatRxJoinMsgs.name: marsStatRxJoinMsgs
marsStatRxJoinMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_JOINS messages received by this MARS.

marsStatRxLeaveMsgs.name: marsStatRxLeaveMsgs
marsStatRxLeaveMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_LEAVES messages received by this MARS.

marsStatRxMservMsgs.name: marsStatRxMservMsgs
marsStatRxMservMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_MSERV messages received by this MARS.

marsStatRxUnservMsgs.name: marsStatRxUnservMsgs
marsStatRxUnservMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_UNSERV messages received by this MARS.

marsStatRxBlkJoinMsgs.name: marsStatRxBlkJoinMsgs
marsStatRxBlkJoinMsgs.description: Total number of block joins messages received by this MARS.

marsStatRegMemGroups.name: marsStatRegMemGroups
marsStatRegMemGroups.description: Total number of IP multicast groups with 1 or more joined cluster members.

marsStatRegMcsGroups.name: marsStatRegMcsGroups
marsStatRegMcsGroups.description: Total number of IP multicast groups with 1 or more joined MCSs.

marsMcsTable.name: marsMcsTable
marsMcsTable.description: The objects defined in this table are used for the management of a multicast server (MCS).

marsMcsEntry.name: marsMcsEntry
marsMcsEntry.description: Each entry contains a MCS and its associated attributes.

marsMcsIndex.name: marsMcsIndex
marsMcsIndex.description: The auxiliary variable used to identify instances of the columnar objects in the MCS table.

marsMcsIfIndex.name: marsMcsIfIndex
marsMcsIfIndex.description: The ifIndex of the interface that the MCS is associated with.

marsMcsAddr.name: marsMcsAddr
marsMcsAddr.description: The ATM address associated with the MCS.

marsMcsDefaultMarsAddr.name: marsMcsDefaultMarsAddr
marsMcsDefaultMarsAddr.description: The default MARS ATM address which is needed to setup the initial signalling path between a MCS and its associated MARS.

marsMcsRegistration.name: marsMcsRegistration
marsMcsRegistration.description: An indication with regards to the registration STATUS of this MCS. The registration codes of 'notRegistered (1)', 'registered (2)', and registered (3) are self-explanatory. The 'reRegisteringFault (4)' indicates the MCS is in the process of re-registering with a MARS due to some fault conditions. The 'reRegisteringRedMap (5)' status code shows that MCS is re-registering because it has received a MARS_REDIRECT_MAP message and was told to register with a shift MARS.

marsMcsSsn.name: marsMcsSsn
marsMcsSsn.description: The MCS own 32 bit Server Sequence Number. It is used to track the Mars sequence number.

marsMcsDefaultMtu.name: marsMcsDefaultMtu
marsMcsDefaultMtu.description: The default maximum transmission unit (MTU) used for this cluster. Note that the actual size used for a VC between two members of the cluster may be negotiated during connection setup and may be different than this value. Default value = 9180 bytes.

marsMcsFailureTimer.name: marsMcsFailureTimer
marsMcsFailureTimer.description: A timer used to flag the failure of last MARS_MULTI to arrive. Default value = 10 seconds (recommended).

marsMcsRetranDelayTimer.name: marsMcsRetranDelayTimer
marsMcsRetranDelayTimer.description: The delay timer for sending out new MARS_REQUEST for the group after the MCS learned that there is no other group in the cluster. The timer must be set between 5 and 10 seconds inclusive.

marsMcsRdmMulReqAddRetrTimer.name: marsMcsRdmMulReqAddRetrTimer
marsMcsRdmMulReqAddRetrTimer.description: The initial random L_MULTI_RQ/ADD retransmit timer which can be set between 5 and 10 seconds inclusive.

marsMcsRdmVcRevalidateTimer.name: marsMcsRdmVcRevalidateTimer
marsMcsRdmVcRevalidateTimer.description: The random time to set VC_revalidate flag. The timer value ranges between 1 and 10 seconds inclusive.

marsMcsRegisterRetrInterval.name: marsMcsRegisterRetrInterval
marsMcsRegisterRetrInterval.description: MARS_MSERV/UNSERV retransmit interval. The minimum and recommended values are 5 and 10 seconds, respectively.

marsMcsRegisterRetrLimit.name: marsMcsRegisterRetrLimit
marsMcsRegisterRetrLimit.description: MARS_MSERV/UNSERV retransmit limit. The maximum value is 5.

marsMcsRegWithMarsRdmTimer.name: marsMcsRegWithMarsRdmTimer
marsMcsRegWithMarsRdmTimer.description: Random time for a MCS to register with a MARS.

marsMcsForceWaitTimer.name: marsMcsForceWaitTimer
marsMcsForceWaitTimer.description: Force wait if MARS re-registration is looping. The minimum value is 1 minute.

marsMcsLmtToMissRedirMapTimer.name: marsMcsLmtToMissRedirMapTimer
marsMcsLmtToMissRedirMapTimer.description: Timer limit for MCS to miss MARS_REDIRECT_MAPS.

marsMcsIdleTimer.name: marsMcsIdleTimer
marsMcsIdleTimer.description: The configurable inactivity timer associated with a MCS. When a VC is created at this MCS, it gets the idle timer value from this configurable timer. The minimum suggested value is 1 minute and the recommended default value is 20 minutes.

marsMcsRowStatus.name: marsMcsRowStatus
marsMcsRowStatus.description: The object is used to create, delete or modify a row in this table. A row cannot be made 'active' until instances of all corresponding columns in the row of this table are appropriately configured and until the agent has also created a corresponding row in the marsMcsStatTable. When this object has a value of 'active', the following columnar objects can not be modified: marsMcsDefaultMarsAddr, marsMcsSsn, marsMcsRegstration, marsMcsDefaultMtu while other objects in this conceptual row can be modified irrespective of the value of this object. Deletion of this row is allowed regardless of whether or not a row in any associated tables (i.e., marsMcsVcTable) still exists or is in use. Once this row is deleted, it is recommended that the agent or the SNMP management station (if possible) through the set command deletes any stale rows that are associated with this row.

marsMcsMcGrpTable.name: marsMcsMcGrpTable
marsMcsMcGrpTable.description: This table contains a list of IP multicast group address blocks associated by a MARS MCS. The MCS uses the information contained in list to advertise its multicast group service to the MARS. Each row can be created or deleted via configuration.

marsMcsMcGrpEntry.name: marsMcsMcGrpEntry
marsMcsMcGrpEntry.description: Each entry represents a consecutive block of multicast group addresses.

marsMcsMcMinGrpAddr.name: marsMcsMcMinGrpAddr
marsMcsMcMinGrpAddr.description: Minimum multicast group address - the min and max multicast forms multi-group block. If the MinGrpAddr and MaxGrpAddr are the same, it indicates that this block contains a single group address. Since the block joins are no allowed by a MCS as implied in the RFC2022, the MinGrpAddr and MaxGrpAddress should be set to the same value at this time when an entry row is created.

marsMcsMcMaxGrpAddr.name: marsMcsMcMaxGrpAddr
marsMcsMcMaxGrpAddr.description: Maximum multicast group address - the min and max multicast forms a multi-group block. If the MinGrpAddr and MaxGrpAddr are the same, it indicates that this block contains a single group address. Since the block joins are no allowed by a MCS as implied in the RFC2022, the MinGrpAddr and MaxGrpAddress should be set to the same value at this time when an entry row is created.

marsMcsMcGrpRowStatus.name: marsMcsMcGrpRowStatus
marsMcsMcGrpRowStatus.description: The object is used to create or delete a row in this table. Since other objects in this row are not-accessible 'index-objects', the value of this object has no effect on whether those objects in this conceptual row can be modified.

marsMcsBackupMarsTable.name: marsMcsBackupMarsTable
marsMcsBackupMarsTable.description: This table contains a list of backup MARS addresses that a MCS can make contact to in case of failure for connecting to the primary server. The list of addresses is in descending order of preference. It should be noted that the backup list provided by the MARS to the MCS via the MARS_REDIRECT_MAP message has a higher preference than addresses that are manually configured into the MCS. When such a list is received from the MARS, this information should be inserted at the top of the list. Each row can be created or deleted via configuration.

marsMcsBackupMarsEntry.name: marsMcsBackupMarsEntry
marsMcsBackupMarsEntry.description: Each entry represents an ATM address of a backup MARS.

marsMcsBackupMarsPriority.name: marsMcsBackupMarsPriority
marsMcsBackupMarsPriority.description: The priority associated with a backup MARS. A lower priority value inidcates a higher preference.

marsMcsBackupMarsAddr.name: marsMcsBackupMarsAddr
marsMcsBackupMarsAddr.description: The ATM address associated with a backup MARS.

marsMcsBackupMarsRowStatus.name: marsMcsBackupMarsRowStatus
marsMcsBackupMarsRowStatus.description: The object is used to create or delete a row in this table. Since other objects in this row are not-accessible 'index-objects', the value of this object has no effect on whether those objects in this conceptual row can be modified.

marsMcsVcTable.name: marsMcsVcTable
marsMcsVcTable.description: This table contains information about open virtual circuits (VCs) that a MCS has. For point to point circuit, each entry represents a single VC connection between this MCS ATM address to another party ATM address. In the case of point to multipoint connection where a single source address is associated with multiple destinations, several entries are used to represent the relationship. An example of point to multi-point VC represented in a table is shown below. MCS VPI/VCI Grp Addr1/Addr2 Part Addr 1 0,1 g1,g2 p1 1 0,1 g1,g2 p2 1 0,1 g1,g2 p3

marsMcsVcEntry.name: marsMcsVcEntry
marsMcsVcEntry.description: The objects contained in the entry are VC related attributes such as VC signalling type, control VC type, idle timer, negotiated MTU size, etc.

marsMcsVcVpi.name: marsMcsVcVpi
marsMcsVcVpi.description: The value of virtual path identifier (VPI). Since a VPI can be numbered 0, this sub-index can take a value of 0.

marsMcsVcVci.name: marsMcsVcVci
marsMcsVcVci.description: The value of virtual circuit identifier (VCI). Since a VCI can be numbered 0, this sub-index can take a value of 0.

marsMcsVcMinGrpAddr.name: marsMcsVcMinGrpAddr
marsMcsVcMinGrpAddr.description: Minimum IP multicast group address - the min and max multicast forms a multi-group block which is associated with a VC. If the MinGrpAddr and MaxGrpAddr are the same, it indicates that the size of multi-group block is 1, a single IP group.

marsMcsVcMaxGrpAddr.name: marsMcsVcMaxGrpAddr
marsMcsVcMaxGrpAddr.description: Maximum IP multicast group address - the min and max multicast forms a multi-group block which is associated with a VC. If the MinGrpAddr and MaxGrpAddr are the same, it indicates that the size of multi-group block is 1, a single IP group.

marsMcsVcPartyAddr.name: marsMcsVcPartyAddr
marsMcsVcPartyAddr.description: An ATM party address in which this VC is linked. The party type is identified by the marsMcsVcPartyAddrType.

marsMcsVcPartyAddrType.name: marsMcsVcPartyAddrType
marsMcsVcPartyAddrType.description: The party type is associated with the party address. The called (1) indicates that the party address is a destination address which implies that VC is originated from this MCS. The calling (2) indicates the VC was initiated externally to this MCS. In this case, the party address is the source address.

marsMcsVcType.name: marsMcsVcType
marsMcsVcType.description: Circuit Connection type: permanent virtual circuit or switched virtual circuit.

marsMcsVcCtrlType.name: marsMcsVcCtrlType
marsMcsVcCtrlType.description: Control VC type used to specify a particular connection. pointToPointVC (1): used by the ATM Clients for the registration and queries. This VC or the initial signalling path is set up from the source MCS to a MARS. It is bi-directional. serverControlVC (2): used by a MARS to issue asynchronous updates to an ATM Client. This VC is established from the MARS to the MCS. pointToMultiPointVC (3): used by the client to transfer multicast data packets from layer 3. This VC is established from this VC to a cluster member.

marsMcsVcIdleTimer.name: marsMcsVcIdleTimer
marsMcsVcIdleTimer.description: The idle timer associated with this VC. The minimum suggested value is 1 minute and the recommended default value is 20 minutes.

marsMcsVcRevalidate.name: marsMcsVcRevalidate
marsMcsVcRevalidate.description: A flag associated with an open and active multipoint VC. It is checked every time a packet is queued for transmission on that VC. The object has the value of true (1) if revalidate is required and the value false (2) otherwise.

marsMcsVcEncapsType.name: marsMcsVcEncapsType
marsMcsVcEncapsType.description: The encapsulation type used when communicating over this VC.

marsMcsVcNegotiatedMtu.name: marsMcsVcNegotiatedMtu
marsMcsVcNegotiatedMtu.description: The negotiated MTU when communicating over this VC.

marsMcsVcRowStatus.name: marsMcsVcRowStatus
marsMcsVcRowStatus.description: The object is used to create, delete or modify a row in this table. A row cannot be made 'active' until instances of all corresponding columns in the row of this table are appropriately configured. While objects: marsMcsVcIdleTimer and marsMcsVcRevalidate in this conceptual row can be modified irrespective of the value of this object, all other objects in the row can not be modified when this object has a value of 'active'. It is possible for an SNMP management station to set the row to 'notInService' and modify the entry and then set it back to 'active' with the following exception. That is, rows for which the corresponding instance of marsMcsVcType has a value of 'svc' can not be modified or deleted.

marsMcsStatTable.name: marsMcsStatTable
marsMcsStatTable.description: The table contains statistics collected at MARS MCSs.

marsMcsStatEntry.name: marsMcsStatEntry
marsMcsStatEntry.description: Each entry contains statistics collected at one MARS MCS.

marsMcsStatTxReqMsgs.name: marsMcsStatTxReqMsgs
marsMcsStatTxReqMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_REQUEST messages transmitted from this MCS.

marsMcsStatTxMservMsgs.name: marsMcsStatTxMservMsgs
marsMcsStatTxMservMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_MSERV messages transmitted from this MCS.

marsMcsStatTxUnservMsgs.name: marsMcsStatTxUnservMsgs
marsMcsStatTxUnservMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_UNSERV messages transmitted from this MCS.

marsMcsStatRxMultiMsgs.name: marsMcsStatRxMultiMsgs
marsMcsStatRxMultiMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_MULTI messages received by this MCS.

marsMcsStatRxSjoinMsgs.name: marsMcsStatRxSjoinMsgs
marsMcsStatRxSjoinMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_SJOIN messages received by this MCS.

marsMcsStatRxSleaveMsgs.name: marsMcsStatRxSleaveMsgs
marsMcsStatRxSleaveMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_SLEAVE messages received by this MCS.

marsMcsStatRxNakMsgs.name: marsMcsStatRxNakMsgs
marsMcsStatRxNakMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_NAK messages received by this MCS.

marsMcsStatRxMigrateMsgs.name: marsMcsStatRxMigrateMsgs
marsMcsStatRxMigrateMsgs.description: Total number of MARS_MIGRATE messages received by this MCS.

marsMcsStatFailMultiMsgs.name: marsMcsStatFailMultiMsgs
marsMcsStatFailMultiMsgs.description: Total number of timeouts occurred indicating failure of the last MARS_MULTI to arrive.

marsFaultTrap.name: marsFaultTrap
marsFaultTrap.description: This trap/inform is sent to the manager whenever there is a fault condition occurred on a MARS.

marsClientCompliance.name: marsClientCompliance
marsClientCompliance.description: The compliance statement for entities that are required for the management of MARS clients.

marsClientGroup.name: marsClientGroup
marsClientGroup.description: A collection of objects to be implemented in a MIB for the management of MARS clients.

marsServerCompliance.name: marsServerCompliance
marsServerCompliance.description: The compliance statement for entities that are required for the management of MARS servers.

marsServerGroup.name: marsServerGroup
marsServerGroup.description: A collection of objects to be implemented in a MIB for the management of MARS servers.

marsServerEventGroup.name: marsServerEventGroup
marsServerEventGroup.description: A collection of events that can be generated from a MARS server.

marsMcsCompliance.name: marsMcsCompliance
marsMcsCompliance.description: The compliance statement for entities that are required for the management of MARS multicast servers (MCS).

marsMcsGroup.name: marsMcsGroup
marsMcsGroup.description: A collection of objects to be implemented in a MIB for the management of MARS multicast servers (MCS).
